title: SF Supervisor Mandelman's Office, the Mayor's Office, the Planning Department and APE (San Francisco Planning)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, emails and texts shared between Supervisor Rafael Mandelman's office, the Mayor's Office and the Planning Department concerning Another Planet Entertainment (APE) and/or the Castro Theatre for the period of January 1, 2022 to the date of this request. Complete documentation requested in particular from Rafael Mandelman and Jackie Thornhill (in Supervisor Rafael Mandelman's office), Victor Ruiz-Cornejo (in the Mayor's Office) and Alex Westhoff and Rich Hillis (the Planning Department).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Synergy 94114

title: Request for Complaints and Related Records Pertaining to Governor Ron DeSantis' Statements on Immigration and General Conduct

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Complaints and Related Records Pertaining to Governor Ron DeSantis' Statements on Immigration and General Conduct
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Date: May 18, 2023

Federal Communications Commission
Office of the Secretary
45 L Street, NE
Washington, DC 20554

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Complaints Regarding Governor Ron DeSantis

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the stipulations of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all complaints made to the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) regarding Florida Governor and potential 2024 candidate Ron DeSantis from May 18, 2020, to the present date.

Specifically, I am interested in the following:

Complaints related to any broadcast of speeches, interviews, or public appearances by Governor DeSantis, with a particular emphasis on those concerning his statements about immigration and the "border crisis."

General complaints against Governor DeSantis that are unrelated to the aforementioned topics.

Complaints related to any advertisement, campaign material, or political messaging associated with Governor DeSantis.

Any records of investigations, resolutions, or regulatory actions resulting from these complaints.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: Request for Communications and Records Related to Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Communications and Records Related to Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission
100 F Street, NE
Washington, DC 20549

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) t Request for Communications and Records Related to Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) 

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of records related to Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) in possession of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) from May 18, 2018, to the present date. This request is comprehensive and includes, but is not limited to, the following categories of records:

Records of communication (including emails, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, and other related correspondences) between the SEC and the Federal Reserve Board of Governors pertaining to CBDCs.

Records of communication (including emails, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, and other related correspondences) between the SEC and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) related to CBDCs.

All records, documents, or any other form of material held by the SEC that mention, discuss, analyze, or provide viewpoints on CBDCs, with specific focus on potential implications on monetary policy, financial stability, and the wider U.S. economy.

Any SEC internal analyses, reports, or policy papers regarding the potential influence of CBDCs on existing regulations and the implications for regulated entities.

Any communications or advisories from the SEC to regulated entities regarding the implications of CBDCs for their operations and regulatory compliance.

Any records of discussions or meetings involving the SEC, Federal Reserve, and FTC that pertain to international cooperation or alignment on CBDC policies and regulations.

I request that these records be provided in a machine-readable format, as defined by the U.S. General Services Administration's Open Data Policy. If any portion of the requested records is deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in compliance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If entire documents are being withheld, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log in line with Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note the obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any unlawful withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records is a violation of the FOIA and can result in litigation, as affirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).



In accordance with FOIA, I expect your response to this request within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)). If access to the records will take longer than this timeframe, please contact me with an estimated date of completion.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

Washington, DC 20505

To Whom It May Concern:

Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request - Investigation of Hillary Clinton's Emails

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), I hereby request the following records:

All records, reports, memos, or communications related to the Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) investigation or involvement, if any, in the matter concerning Hillary Clinton's private email server and the handling of classified information during her tenure as Secretary of State from January 21, 2009, to February 1, 2013.
Any internal reviews, investigations, or assessments conducted by the CIA regarding the potential security implications of Secretary Clinton's use of a private email server during the aforementioned time frame.
Any correspondence or communications between the CIA and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) or the Department of State regarding the investigation of Hillary Clinton's emails, specifically from January 21, 2009, to February 1, 2013.
Any declarations or statements made by the CIA, whether publicly or internally, regarding the classification status of documents related to the investigation of Hillary Clinton's emails during the specified time period.
In particular, I request any records, correspondence, or communications involving the following key individuals who held prominent positions within the CIA during the specified time frame:

CIA Director:

Leon Panetta (January 21, 2009 - June 30, 2011)
David Petraeus (September 6, 2011 - November 9, 2012)
Michael Morell (Acting Director, November 9, 2012 - March 8, 2013)
CIA Deputy Director:

Stephen R. Kappes (January 21, 2009 - May 14, 2010)
Michael Morell (May 14, 2010 - August 9, 2013)
CIA Chief of Staff:

Jeremy Bash (January 21, 2009 - August 16, 2011)
Benjamin Powell (August 16, 2011 - February 1, 2013)
These individuals played significant roles within the CIA during the specified time period, and any records involving their communications, decision-making, or actions related to the investigation of Hillary Clinton's emails are of particular interest.

In support of this FOIA request, I would like to reference the following court cases that emphasize the importance of public access to information under the FOIA:

Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington (CREW) v. U.S. Department of Justice, 746 F.3d 1082 (D.C. Cir. 2014): The court emphasized the broad scope of the FOIA, stating that it is not limited to the specific details of an investigation but also covers information regarding the existence and status of ongoing investigations.
New York Times Co. v. United States, 403 U.S. 713 (1971): The Supreme Court recognized the need for government transparency and accountability, especially when matters of public concern are involved.

Additionally, I would like to draw your attention to a tweet posted by former President Donald Trump on October 6, 2020, in which he refers to the declaration or declassification of certain documents related to the investigation of Hillary Clinton's emails. For your reference, I have attached a screenshot of the tweet to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: Ossining Police Department Twitter Block List

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Ossining Police Department Twitter Block List
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Ossining Police Department
88 Spring Street
Ossining, NY 10562

Dear Freedom of Information Act Officer,

Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request

I hope this letter finds you well. Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, I am requesting access to the list of Twitter profiles blocked by the Ossining Police Department's official Twitter account (@OssiningPolice).

To assist you in locating these records, please follow the steps below to view the blocked profiles:

Log into the @OssiningPolice Twitter account.
Click on 'More' in the menu on the left-hand side.
Click on 'Settings and privacy'.
Select 'Privacy and safety'.
Scroll down to 'Safety' and click on 'Blocked accounts'. Here, you will find the list of all blocked profiles.
Given that these records relate to a public department's social media, which is utilized for communication with and among the public, they should fall within the purview of the Freedom of Information Act.

I would like to draw your attention to two cases related to social media blocking and the First Amendment. The first is Knight First Amendment Institute v. Trump (2017), where the court found that blocking users from an official's Twitter account, which is used as a public forum, is a violation of their First Amendment rights. The second is Davison v. Randall (2019), where the Fourth Circuit Court of Appeals extended this reasoning to local officials.

While these cases deal with blocking individuals on Twitter, they provide the legal context under which public officials and departments must operate when considering whether to block individuals from their social media accounts.

Given these precedents, the block list of the Ossining Police Department's Twitter account should constitute disclosable public records under the FOIA as they pertain to potential infringements on First Amendment activity.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: 1978/1979 Charles Stanley, Sr. Murder (Jones County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: 1978/1979 Charles Stanley, Sr. Murder (Jones County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting information regarding the murder of Charles Stanley, Sr. in Gray, Georgia, and the subsequent trial and sentencing of his son Charles Stanley, Jr. (The son sometimes went by Charlie.) The murder was identified on Dec. 5 1978 and the trial took place February 8-9, 1979. Information being requested specifically includes: 

- any associated incident and investigation reports from both the GBI and the Jones County Sheriff's Department 
- the full autopsy report
- crime scene photos 
- trial transcripts 
- sentencing documents 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.communication:
Hi Katie,

I wanted to acknowledge that our agency has received your request.
Unfortunately, we don't have anything on this case. Our agency was located
at the courthouse in Jones County until I believe 1997. In the early 90's
we had a flood that destroyed all the files we had in storage.

I understand this isn't the answer you were hoping for. Please let me know
if I can help with anything else.
______________
Brittani Marks

Jones County Sheriff's Office

title: Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request - Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs)

Dear FOIA Officer,

I am writing to request information under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), specifically seeking access to records related to Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) held or discussed by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System.

I kindly request the following information:

Documentation and reports pertaining to the research, development, and evaluation of Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) within the Federal Reserve System.

Correspondence, including emails, memos, and letters, between Federal Reserve officials, Board members, and external entities, such as other central banks, government agencies, and financial institutions, discussing CBDCs.

Any internal studies, white papers, or briefing materials produced by the Federal Reserve on the topic of CBDCs, including analysis of potential benefits, risks, and challenges associated with their implementation.

Records related to pilot programs or proofs-of-concept conducted by the Federal Reserve or in collaboration with other entities to explore CBDCs.

Any public statements, speeches, or presentations made by Federal Reserve officials regarding CBDCs, including transcripts or recordings of such events.

Any agreements, contracts, or arrangements between the Federal Reserve and external entities related to the development or implementation of CBDCs.

Please provide the requested information for the time period starting January 1, 2019, up until the date this FOIA request is processed.

To facilitate the review of this request, I kindly request that the information be provided in a machine-readable and searchable format, such as PDF or Word documents. If possible, please organize the records by category and date.

If any records or portions of records are being withheld or exempted from disclosure, I kindly request an indexed list specifying the withheld or redacted records along with the specific exemption(s) under the FOIA that justify their non-disclosure. Please provide the cited legal provisions or statutory exemptions for each redaction or withholding.



If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions under the FOIA. Additionally, please provide me with an opportunity to appeal the decision.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: Violations of Unlicensed Retail Cannabis Shops for the Past 3 Years

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Violations of Unlicensed Retail Cannabis Shops for the Past 3 Years
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Colorado Department of Revenue


Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request - Violations of Unlicensed Retail Cannabis Shops for the Past 3 Years

Dear FOIA Officer,

I am writing to request information under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), specifically seeking access to records related to violations of unlicensed retail cannabis shops in Colorado for the period of January 1, 2021, to the date this request is processed.

I kindly request that the information provided be in a machine-readable format, such as Excel or CSV, and be made accessible according to the guidelines set forth by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) to ensure compatibility with assistive technologies.

Please provide the following details for each violation, categorized by the points mentioned below:

Category 1: Violation Details

Violation ID/Reference Number
Date of the violation
Location of the unlicensed retail cannabis shop
Nature of the violation
Description of the specific offense
Category 2: Enforcement Actions
6. Actions taken by the Colorado Department of Revenue in response to the violation

Sanctions imposed or penalties levied on the unlicensed retail cannabis shop
Category 3: Resolution Status
8. Current status of each violation (e.g., open, closed, pending)

Any corrective measures implemented by the unlicensed retail cannabis shop to address the violation
Category 4: Additional Information
10. Any supporting documentation related to the violations (e.g., inspection reports, photographs, correspondence)

Furthermore, if any records or portions of records are being withheld or exempted from disclosure, I kindly request an indexed list specifying the withheld or redacted records along with the specific exemption(s) under the FOIA that justify their non-disclosure. Please provide the cited legal provisions or statutory exemptions for each redaction or withholding.

To ensure compliance with ADA guidelines, please make the information accessible to individuals using assistive technologies, such as screen readers or text-to-speech software.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions under the FOIA. Additionally, please provide me with an opportunity to appeal the decision.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter
